text.p: - Congratulations to the president and his doctors, the newspaper says after President Boris Yeltsin's heart operation.
- Russia's general prosecutor's office has launched an investigation into the finances of the diamond producer Almazy Rossii-Sakha over tax evasion and currency violations.
- Yeltsin's surgery did not have much affect on Russia's share markets.
- Russian-American relations will not depend on the results of the presidential elections in the U.S.
- Yeltsin's operation is successful, according to his doctors.
- Russia's Security Council is ready to present a new version of the military doctrine.

- While holding his new post, Viktor Stepanovich did not manage to do very much, writes the paper referring to the short period of time during Yeltsin's heart surgery when presidenial powers were handed to Prime Minister Chernomyrdin.
- If a bypass operation is a success, a patient usually resumes his ability to work almost immediately and in 10 days he can leave the hospital, the paper quotes doctors as saying.
- Russia's government has decided to privatise the Domodedovo airport, which is located to the south of Moscow.

- Let's consolidate our efforts in the struggle for freedom, social justice and for restoration of the rights won by our fathers and grandfathers, writes the paper on the eve of the 79th anniversary of the Bolshevik Revolution.
- Great October lives in our hearts! - is today's banner headline written in red.
